    species->nestingtype;

Let the predicted presence P of species s of genus g and nesting type n on atoll a be:

# Random intercept only
$$
\begin{split}
\begin{aligned}

P_{as} &= \beta_{0a} + \epsilon_{as}\\
\beta_{0a} &= \gamma_{00} + U_{0a}

\end{aligned}
\end{split}
$$

# Random intercept and species
$$
\begin{split}
\begin{aligned}

P_{as} &= \beta_{0a} + \beta_{1s}(Species_s) + \epsilon_{as} \\ %% check notation for index coefficients (beta1s)
\beta_{0a} &= \gamma_{00} + U_{0a}

\end{aligned}
\end{split}
$$

# Random intercept and species and PCs

$$
\begin{split}
\begin{aligned}

P_{as} &= \beta_{0a} + \beta_{1s}(Species_s) + \beta_{2s}(PC1) + \dots + \beta_{7s}(PC6) + \epsilon_{as} \\
\beta_{0a} &= \gamma_{00} + U_{0a}

\end{aligned}
\end{split}
$$

# Random intercept and species and PCs interacting with nesting type

$$
\begin{split}
\begin{aligned}

P_{asn} &= \alpha_{a} + \beta_{s}(Species_s) + \theta_{1s}(PC1) + \dots + \theta_{6s}(PC6) + \gamma(Nesting_n) + \epsilon_{as} \\
\beta_{0a} &= \gamma_{00} + U_{0a}

\end{aligned}
\end{split}
$$

# Random intercept and species and PCs interacting with nesting type

$$
\begin{split}
\begin{aligned}

P_{asn} &= \beta_{0a} + \beta_{1s}(Species_s) + \beta_{2s}(PC1) + \dots + \beta_{7s}(PC6) + \beta_{8ns} + \epsilon_{as} \\
\beta_{0a} &= \gamma_{00} + U_{0a} \\
\beta_{8ns} &= \gamma_{800} + U_{8s}

\end{aligned}
\end{split}
$$

# Draft

Level 1: Species

$$
\begin{split}
\begin{aligned}
L1: \\
P_{sna} &= \beta_{0na} + \beta_{1na}(Species_s) + \epsilon_{sna} \\
\\
L2: \\
\beta_{0na} &= \gamma_{00a} + \gamma_{01a}(Nesting_n) \\
\beta_{1na} &= \gamma_{10a} + \gamma_{11a}(Nesting_n) \\
\\
L3: \\
\gamma_{00a} &= \theta_{000} + U_{00a} \\
\gamma_{01a} &= \theta_{010} + U_{01a} \\
\gamma_{10a} &= \theta_{100} + U_{10a} \\
\gamma_{11a} &= \theta_{110} + U_{11a} \\

\end{aligned}
\end{split}
$$

$$
\begin{split}
\begin{aligned}
L1: \\
P_{sna} &= \beta_{0a} + \beta_{1as} + \beta_{2an} + \epsilon_{sna} \\
\\
L2: \\
\beta_{0a} &= \gamma_{00} + \gamma_{01}(PC1) + \dots + \gamma_{06}(PC6) + U_{0a} \\
\beta_{1as} &= \gamma_{10s} + \gamma_{11s}(PC1) + \dots + \gamma_{16s}(PC6) + U_{1a} \\
\beta_{2an} &= \gamma_{20n} + \gamma_{21n}(PC1) + \dots + \gamma_{26n}(PC6) + U_{2a} \\
L3: \\
\gamma_{10s} &= \gamma_{100} + \gamma_{101}(Species_s) \\
\gamma_{11s} &= \gamma_{110} + \gamma_{111}(Species_s) \\
\gamma_{20n} &= \gamma_{200} + \gamma_{201}(Nesting_n) \\
\gamma_{21n} &= \gamma_{210} + \gamma_{211}(Nesting_n)
\end{aligned}
\end{split}
$$

Consider that for species s we have a $\beta_1$ parameters -> this is a distribution of $\beta_1$ parameters!

SPECIES WITHIN NESTING TYPES
gamma parameters are separate distributions for each nesting type
main model would be $\theta1_{n, s}$ = when you estimate a new species, look at the distribution for that nesting type
=> we can average over all species within each nesting type

$$
\begin{split}
\begin{aligned}
\gamma_{01s} = \gamma_{010} + \gamma_{011}(Species_s)
\end{aligned}
\end{split}
$$
